result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel F Heinritz

records.addlTxt:
9:31 AM Defendant Daniel F Heinritz in court.  Prosecuting attorney Trisha L Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has applied for SPD but counsel has not yet been appointed, requested adjournment.
Status conference scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 02:40 pm.
Status conference on December 5, 2022 at 02:40 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process prior to release.

Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br 5

11:46 AM Defendant Daniel F Heinritz in court.  Attorney Jason Carlos Gonzalez in court for Daniel F Heinritz.  Prosecuting attorney Kyle Olsen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.
Status conference scheduled for November 4, 2022 at 09:30 am.
